intro: Sisymbrium minus, commonly known as lesser winter cress, is an annual herbaceous plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm and has erect, branching stems covered with fine hairs. The leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a slightly serrated edge. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom in the spring. The plant produces small, round pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
